Abidjan(former capital; still hosts some government offices)
Abidjan is the largest city in Ivory Coast and is officially designated as the economic capital.
Yemen is in a state ofcivil war, and Sanaa has been occupied byHouthirebels since September 2014. Aden, the former capital ofSouth Yemen, is Yemen's acting capital.
Self-governing in free associationwithNew Zealand. Government offices are spread across both Alofi North and Alofi South.
The Hague hoststhe monarch,government ministries,judiciaryanddiplomatic missions. See alsoCapital of the Netherlands.
Ankara became capital of the newly-formed Republic of Turkey in 1923, after theTurkish War of Independence. The capital of Turkey's predecessor, theOttoman Empire, wasConstantinople(nowIstanbul).
Astana was named Nur-Sultan from 2019 to 2022.Almatywas the capital of Kazakhstan from 1991 to 1997 and its predecessor theKazakh SSRfrom 1929 to 1991.
Most populous city and smallestatoll.New ZealandownsTokelau.
Largestatoll. the population of people living there is 531.
Most populous city in thisatollisFale, Tokelau
Self-governing in free associationwithNew Zealand. The capital is sometimes incorrectly stated asRarotonga, the island on which Avarua is located.
Belize Citywas the capital of Belize's predecessor,British Honduras.
Bonnwas the capital ofWest Germanyand remained theseat of governmentfor reunified Germany until 1999, and is still the primary seat of sixministries. See alsoCapital of Germany.

British Overseas Territory. Plymouth was abandoned after theSoufrière Hillsvolcano erupted in 1997. Since then, government offices have been moved toBrades, which is in northwestern Montserrat. A new capital,Little Bay, is currently under construction.
Rio de Janeirowas the capital until 1960. See also:Capitals of Brazil.
Brussels alsoserves asde factocapitalof theEuropean Union.[1]
See also:List of historical capitals of Hungary.
A new capital is being built at theNew Administrative Capital. It might be named Egypt. See also:List of historical capitals of Egypt.

Planned city built to mitigate the rivalry betweenMelbourne(de factocapital at the time) andSydney(economic capital and most populous city), both of which were put forward as potential capitals in the Australasia Federation Conventions of the 1890s.Section 125 of the Constitutiongives basic details about the location of the capital, size of the encompassing territory and so forth, while theSeat of Government Act 1908specified its precise location.
Until 1982, the capital was Colombo, where many governmental institutions remain; it is still designated as the commercial capital of Sri Lanka. See also:Capital of Sri Lanka.
Also known as Kotte, the city is asuburbof Colombo.
Dar es Salaam, the former capital and largest city, still hosts somegovernment ministries, thejudiciary, anddiplomatic missions.
Part of theBritish Overseas TerritoryofSaint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha.
Part of theBritish Overseas TerritoryofSaint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha.
Bujumbura was the capital from 1962 to 2018.
See also:List of historical capitals of Vietnam.
De factoindependent state, deemed by the UN to bede jurepart of Somalia.
Honiara is a settlement on the island ofGuadalcanal.

Karachiserved as the first capital of Pakistan from 1948. A planned capital, Islamabad, was then designated, and in 1958, as an interim measure, the capital was shifted toRawalpindi, near to the future capital. Islamabad became capital in 1967 when its construction was completed.
The capital will be moved toNusantaraon Borneo. See also:Capital of Indonesia.
Part of theBritish Overseas TerritoryofSaint Helena, Ascension and Tristan da Cunha.

TheJerusalem Lawstates that "Jerusalem, complete and united, is the capital of Israel" and the city serves as the seat of the Israeli government and its institutions.United Nations Security Council Resolution 478declared the Jerusalem Law "null and void" and called on member states to withdraw their diplomatic missions from Jerusalem. Nearly all countries currently havetheir embassiesin and aroundTel Aviv. Defying theUN,[2]the United Statesrecognized Jerusalem as the capitaland movedits embassythere in May 2018.[3]Many countries officially adhere to the proposal that Jerusalem should have international status, as called for in the1947 Partition Plan.[4]
South Georgia and the South Sandwich Islands
Kuala Lumpur(de jure, legislative and royal)
La Pazis thehighest administrative capital(3,650 m) in the world, higher than Quito.[5]

De factoindependent statecontested by both theSahrawi Arab Democratic Republic(SADR), andMorocco.  Laayoune is withinMoroccan-controlled territorywhile Tifariti is withinSahrawi-controlled territoryand serves as thetemporary capital(previouslyBir Lehlou).  Some government and military buildings reside in exile inTindouf, Algeria.[6]See also:Politics of the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic.

Cuscois declared the "historical capital" (Spanish:capital histórica), by Article 49 of thePeruvian Constitution, a merely symbolic statement.Arequipais deemed the "legal capital" as it is the seat of theConstitutional Court.

Prior to theActs of Union in 1707, London was the capital of England only; Edinburgh was the capital of theKingdom of Scotland. The United Kingdom includes the subdivisions ofEngland (capital London),Scotland (capitalEdinburgh),Wales (capitalCardiff), Northern Ireland (capitalBelfast).
British Overseas Territory. Officially, the British Indian Ocean Territory is administered from London,[7]though some consider the capital to beDiego Garcia.[8]
Self-governing infree associationwith theUnited States. The seat of government is atDelap-Uliga-Djarrit, a settlement on the atoll of Majuro.
Ciudad de la Pazis currently under construction and will become the new capital when complete.[9]

City-state. Monaco does not have a capital designated inits constitution; however, the Commune of Monaco, the country's onlycommune, is coterminous with the nation, making it thede factocapital.[10][11]
Yangonwas the capital until 2006.[12]See also:List of capitals of Myanmar.
Calcuttawas the capital ofIndiauntil 1911 during theBritish Raj.
Self-governing infree associationwith theUnited States.Koror Citywas the capital until 2006.
Nicosia is adivided capital, split between Cyprus, which claims the whole city, and theinternationally unrecognizedbreakaway state of Northern Cyprus.
Self-governing country within theKingdom of Denmark.
Self-governing country within theKingdom of the Netherlands.
See also:List of historical capitals of Norway.
Self-governing infree associationwith theUnited States.Koloniais the former capital andAustralia,China,Japanand theUnited Statesretain embassies there.
See also:List of Capitals of France.
Self-governing country within theKingdom of the Netherlands.
Cetinjehas been designated the "Old Royal Capital" and is the present seat of thePresident.
TheSupreme Court of the Czech Republicis located inBrno.[13]
De factoindependent stateclaimed entirely bySerbiaas part of itsAutonomous Province of Kosovo and Metohija.
Territoryof theUnited States. The seat of government is atCapitol Hill, a settlement on the island of Saipan.
TheNational Congress of Chileis located inValparaíso.
On 2 July 2012, some government functions moved toSejong City, which became thede factoadministrative capital.
South Tarawa is a settlement on the atoll ofTarawa.
De factoindependent statewith partial recognitionclaimed in whole byGeorgiaas theAutonomous Republic of Abkhazia.

De factoindependent state, officially called the Republic of China, in competition with thePeople's Republic of Chinafor recognition as thesole Chinese governmentsince 1949. Taiwan controls theisland of Taiwanand theassociated islandsQuemoy, Matsu, the Pratas, and part of theSpratly Islands.[Note 1]Its territory is claimed in whole by the People's Republic of China.[Note 2]The Republic of China participates in a number of international organizations under a variety of pseudonyms, most commonlyChinese Taipei.
From 2012 to 2018,Kutaisiserved as Georgia's legislative capital. Additionally,Mtskhetais sometimes called an "ancient capital" of Georgia.[16][17]
Comayagüela is declared in theHonduran Constitutionas co-official capital with Tegucigalpa.[18]The cities have since merged into a single urban area.
De factoindependent state,recognized by only non UN members. Claimed in whole byMoldovaas the autonomous territorial unit ofAdministrative-Territorial Units of the Left Bank of the Dniester
Self-governing country within theKingdom of Denmark.
De factoindependent statewith limited recognition. Claimed in whole byGeorgiaas theProvisional Administration of South Ossetia.

The capital of the United States has moved several times. See also:National capitals of the United States.
Since 1865. Wellington is New Zealand's third capital. See also:Capital of New Zealand.
Self-governing country within theKingdom of the Netherlands.
Nauru has no official capital, nor cities; the government offices are in Yaren district.
